intro: Lippia scaposa, commonly known as Mexican blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its square, hairy stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, blue or violet flowers that are clustered in spikes, giving it a distinctive appearance. Lippia scaposa is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to a variety of environmental conditions. It has been used in traditional medicine for its purported medicinal properties.
